situation: S had difficulty entering the classroom after witnessing a minor car accident outside the school. He became extremely anxious and sat on the floor at the entrance, refusing to join the class.
action: The teacher aide attempted to verbally encourage S to stand up and come inside, repeating instructions loudly. When S did not respond, the aide left him alone while attending to other tasks.
effect: S remained outside the classroom for over an hour, missing out on important class activities. The loud approach contributed to S's anxiety, delaying his readiness to engage.
